intro: Aneilema bracteolatum var. majus, commonly known as the purple-leafed hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Africa. It is characterized by its striking, velvety purple leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. The flowers bloom in clusters and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
